name: Bort's Blessing
desc: This ornate copper band has a small ruby set in the center, flanked by a pair of dwarven runes. The wearer of this ring gains the ability to understand, read, and speak one common language of their choice, selected each morning as part of their daily preparations. In addition, the wearer receives a +1 item bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 item bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression.
You gain the ability to understand, read, and speak one common language of your choice, selected each morning as part of your daily preparations.

name: Merchant's Guile
desc: The band of this ring is made from blue-colored iron and has two sharp, decorative protrusions on each side of the red-stone inlay. It feels quite heavy and reliable. Wearing this ring grants you a +2 item bonus to Deception and Diplomacy checks, but only if the associated checks involve haggling or bargaining over a purchase or trade.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 item bonus to Deception and Diplomacy checks that involve haggling or bargaining over a purchase or trade.

activities.name: Merchant's Guile
activities.desc: You can determine if an item is magical simply by handling it. You detect no other indication of its power, only whether or not it is magical, granting the effects of a 1st-level detect magic spell that affects only the object.

name: Ring of Minor Arcana
desc: This rose-gold ring is adorned in the center by a somewhat ominous-looking horned skull. This ring gives you the power to cast the following innate arcane cantrips any number of times each day: detect magic, mage hand, and prestidigitation. Each is cast as a 1st-level spell. If you are an arcane spellcaster, these can instead be heightened to the level of your cantrips.

name: Ring of the Weary Traveler
desc: This fanciful golden ring has an ornate band cast with delicate, swirling decorations and is inlaid with three bright-green emeralds. While wearing this ring, you gain a +10-foot item bonus to your Speed, but only when determining your overland movement per hour.

hints.desc: You gain a +10-foot item bonus to your Speed, but only when determining your overland movement per hour.

activities.name: Ring of the Weary Traveler
activities.desc: You refresh yourself from fatigue. For 10 minutes, you can ignore the penalties from the fatigued condition. This does not remove the condition, it merely suppresses the penalties and drawbacks of having the condition. If something would cause you to become fatigued again while the ring's power is in effect, the suppression ends, and you immediately take the penalties again.

name: Stalwart's Ring
desc: This fairly simple ring has no gemstone inlaid, but the band is cast to resembled a fanged wolf's head. Once per day, during your daily preparations, you can meditate on this ring to grant yourself 5 temporary Hit Points. These last until your next daily preparation, as long as you are wearing the ring.

activities.name: Stalwart's Ring
activities.desc: Once per day, during your daily preparations, you can meditate on this ring to grant yourself 5 temporary Hit Points. These last until your next daily preparation, as long as you are wearing the ring.

name: Warrior's Training Ring
desc: This ring is utilitarian in design - indicating its martial use. Its band is decorated only with a simple, sharp-edged sculpture on the band's center. While wearing this ring, you add your level to your attack rolls with all weapons with which you are untrained.

activities.name: Warrior's Training Ring
activities.trigger: You make an attack with a weapon in which you're untrained
activities.desc: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. If you are an expert in any weapon, you instead gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.
